source_video: Hyundai Santro Standard Service - POV by GoMechanic.mp4

actions.label: Open Car Hood
actions.description: A mechanic opens the hood of the silver Hyundai Santro to begin the pre-service inspection.

actions.label: Check Engine Oil Level
actions.description: The mechanic uses the dipstick to check the level and condition of the engine oil before draining.

actions.label: Inspect Coolant Level
actions.description: The mechanic visually inspects the coolant level in the expansion tank.

actions.label: Inspect Brake Fluid Level
actions.description: The mechanic checks the level of the brake fluid in its reservoir.

actions.label: Inspect Air Filter
actions.description: The mechanic opens the air filter housing and removes the old air filter for inspection.

actions.label: Position and Lift Car
actions.description: The vehicle is positioned over a two-post hydraulic lift, and the lift arms are placed under the jacking points before raising the car.

actions.label: Underbody Inspection
actions.description: Using a light, the mechanic inspects the car's underbody, including the suspension, exhaust system, and chassis for any issues.

actions.label: Check Tyre Tread Depth
actions.description: A digital tread depth gauge is used to measure the remaining tread on the rear tyre.

actions.label: Drain Old Engine Oil
actions.description: A wrench is used to loosen the drain plug, and the old, dark engine oil is drained into a collection pan.

actions.label: Replace Engine Oil Filter
actions.description: The old oil filter is removed, and a new, genuine Hyundai oil filter is unboxed, its gasket lubricated, and then installed.

actions.label: Remove Front Wheel
actions.description: After loosening the nuts with a pneumatic wrench, the front wheel is removed to access the brake assembly.

actions.label: Inspect Front Brake Pads
actions.description: The mechanic removes the brake pads from the caliper to check their thickness and condition before reinstalling them.

actions.label: Reinstall Front Wheel
actions.description: The wheel is mounted back onto the hub, the nuts are tightened with the pneumatic wrench, and the wheel cover is reattached.

actions.label: Refill New Engine Oil
actions.description: New Mobil 1 0W-40 fully synthetic engine oil is poured into the engine using a funnel.

actions.label: Inspect Spark Plug Condition
actions.description: A spark plug is removed from the engine, its electrode is inspected for wear, and the gap is checked with a feeler gauge.

actions.label: Replace Engine Air Filter
actions.description: The old, dirty engine air filter is discarded and replaced with a new, genuine Hyundai air filter.

actions.label: Top-Up Coolant
actions.description: GoMechanic Smartcool coolant is added to the coolant expansion tank to bring it to the correct level.

actions.label: Apply Battery Terminal Spray
actions.description: A rust protection spray is applied to the battery terminals to prevent corrosion and ensure a good connection.

actions.label: Top-Up Brake Fluid
actions.description: GoMechanic DOT-4 brake fluid is added to the brake fluid reservoir to top it up.

actions.label: Top-Up Windshield Washer Fluid
actions.description: A concentrate is added to the windshield washer fluid reservoir, followed by water.

actions.label: Check Battery Voltage
actions.description: A digital multimeter is used to check the battery's voltage, which reads 12.82V, indicating a healthy charge.

actions.label: Clean and Reinstall Cabin Filter
actions.description: The cabin air filter is removed from behind the glove box, cleaned with compressed air, and then reinstalled.

actions.label: Perform Engine Scan
actions.description: An OBD-II scanner is connected to the car to read and clear any diagnostic trouble codes from the engine control unit (ECU).

actions.label: Underbody Pressure Wash
actions.description: The car is on a wash lift, and a high-pressure water jet is used to clean the underbody, wheel wells, and tyres.

actions.label: Exterior Foam Wash and Rinse
actions.description: The car's exterior is washed by hand with a soapy sponge and then thoroughly rinsed with a pressure washer.
